Class Ship

Battleship.ships.Ship

  • Constructor Details

    • Ship

      public Ship(int size, ShipType type)
      Constructs a new Ship with the specified size and type.
      Parameters:
      size - The size of the ship.
      type - The type of the ship.

  • Method Details

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition(int row, int col)
      Sets the position of the ship on the game grid. Abstract method to be implemented by concrete ship classes. Initializes the ship's parts based on the specified row and column coordinates. Overrides the setPosition method in the Ship class to define the specific positioning logic for Cruiser.
      Specified by:
      setPosition in interface ShipI
      Parameters:
      row - The row position where the ship will be placed.
      col - The column position where the ship will be placed.

    • placeHorizontal

      private void placeHorizontal(int row, int col)
      Places the ship horizontally on the game grid. Initializes the ship's parts in a horizontal arrangement based on the specified row and column coordinates.
      Parameters:
      row - The row position where the leftmost part of the ship will be placed.
      col - The column position where the leftmost part of the ship will be placed.

    • placeVertical

      private void placeVertical(int row, int col)
      Places the ship vertically on the game grid. Initializes the ship's parts in a vertical arrangement based on the specified row and column coordinates.
      Parameters:
      row - The row position where the topmost part of the ship will be placed.
      col - The column position where the topmost part of the ship will be placed.

    • rotate

      public void rotate()
      Rotates the ship. Changes the orientation of the ship from horizontal to vertical or vice versa. Overrides the rotate method in the ShipI interface.
      Specified by:
      rotate in interface ShipI

    • gotHit

      public boolean gotHit(int targetRow, int targetCol)
      Checks if the ship got hit at the specified target coordinates. Overrides the gotHit method in the ShipI interface.
      Specified by:
      gotHit in interface ShipI
      Parameters:
      targetRow - The row position of the target.
      targetCol - The column position of the target.
      Returns:
      True if the ship got hit, false otherwise.

    • checkSinked

      private void checkSinked()
      Checks if the ship is sunk (all parts are hit). If all ship parts are hit, sets the 'sinked' flag to true.

    • removeShip

      public void removeShip()
      Removes the ship from the game grid. Resets shipParts to null and placed to false.

    • getType

      public ShipType getType()
      Gets the type of the ship.
      Returns:
      The type of the ship.

    • isSinked

      public boolean isSinked()
      Checks if the ship is sunk.
      Returns:
      True if the ship is sunk, false otherwise.

    • isPlaced

      public boolean isPlaced()
      Checks if the ship is placed on the game grid.
      Returns:
      True if the ship is placed, false otherwise.

    • getShipParts

      public List<ShipPart> getShipParts()
      Gets the list of ShipPart objects representing the individual parts of the ship.
      Returns:
      The list of ShipPart objects.

    • isRotated

      public boolean isRotated()
      Checks if the ship is rotated.
      Returns:
      True if the ship is rotated, false otherwise.
